comments.author: petergolde
comments.body: I am happy to add documentation also, but I am not familiar with the tools to do so. If you point me to documentation on how to update the documentation I can amend this PR.

comments.author: bholmes
comments.body:
@petergolde,

Yes adding docs would be a great help!  We need to write up some instructions in the README.

For now what I have been doing is running in bash

```
sh bootstrapper.sh -t docs
```

This will modify the docs directory, adding stubs for the classes and members that were added.  The problem that I have is that a bunch of whitespace diffs are introduced when I run this as well.  (I need to get with miguel to see why that is.)  I revert the changes I do not want, then fill in the new stubbed out doc entries.  

To verify my changes I then run...

```
mdoc-export-html -o bill docs/en/
```

The output from this is not perfect either, but will give you a set of html pages to view and review your new changes.  Finally commit the changes to the docs folder.  

Make sense?
